entities.description: Health insurance that covers substance use treatment needs.
Health insurance that does not adequately cover substance use treatment needs.
Awareness or lack thereof about where to get substance use treatment.
Availability of preferred providers for substance use treatment.
Availability of appointments for substance use treatment, including issues with transportation and childcare.
The amount of time available for substance use treatment.
Concerns regarding the privacy of information related to substance use treatment.
Concerns about what people think or say regarding the individual's substance use treatment.

relationships.description: Indicates whether the respondent has health insurance coverage that meets substance use treatment needs.
Indicates that the health insurance coverage is not sufficient to meet the substance use treatment needs.
Indicates a lack of knowledge about where to get substance use treatment.
Indicates whether the preferred provider is available for substance use treatment.
Indicates availability of appointments for substance use treatment.
Indicates whether the respondent has enough time to undergo substance use treatment.
Indicates concerns about the privacy of information related to substance use treatment.
Indicates concerns about social perceptions related to undergoing substance use treatment.
